citation: Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 (Tas)
text:
Proclamation under the Roads and Jetties Act 1935

I, the Lieutenant-Governor in and over the State of Tasmania and its Dependencies in the Commonwealth of Australia, acting with the advice of the Executive Council, by this my proclamation made under section 7 of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 â€“

        (a) declare the roads, or portions of roads, specified in Schedule 1 to this proclamation to be subsidiary roads for the purposes of Part II of the Roads and Jetties Act 1935 and classified as main roads; and
        (b) declare that the road specified in Schedule 2 to this proclamation, to the extent specified in that Schedule, ceases to be a subsidiary road for the purposes of Part II of that Act; and
        (c) amend the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1970, No. 67, as follows:
                (i) by omitting from Part I of the Second Schedule the item relating to the King Island Main Road and substituting the details specified in Schedule 3 to this proclamation;
                (ii) by omitting from Part II of the Second Schedule the item relating to the Pegarah Secondary Road; and
        (d) revoke the proclamation notified in the Gazette as Statutory Rules 1971, No. 32; and
        (e) declare that this proclamation takes effect on the day upon which its making is notified in the Gazette.
27 October 2014

A. M. BLOW

Lieutenant-Governor

By His Excellency's Command,

M. T. (RENE) HIDDING

Minister for Infrastructure

SCHEDULE 1 - Subsidiary roads

Item  Description  Length in kilometres  1.  Grassy Harbour Road from its junction with the existing King Island Main Road approximately 1.05 kilometres west of Ti-Tree Drive, Grassy, to the boundary of the King Island Ports Corporation property at Grassy Harbour.  2.80  2.  The portion of Don Kendall Drive from its junction with the existing King Island Main Road approximately 2.84 kilometres north of Racecourse Road, Currie, to its junction with Morrison Avenue.  1.63  3.  Morrison Avenue from its junction with Don Kendall Drive to the boundary of the King Island Airport property.  1.04
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   


SCHEDULE 2 - Road ceasing to be Subsidiary Road

Name  Extent  Pegarah Secondary Road  All
                                         


SCHEDULE 3 - New definition of King Island Main Road

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                44.81             
Name  Definition  Length in miles  King Island Main Road  From the junction of Rocky Point Road and Haines Road near Egg Lagoon to Blackwood Street, Grassy, via Reekara, Main Street and Edward Street in Currie, Pegarah, and Lymwood (partly North Road and partly Grassy Road), and including the Grassy Harbour Road to the boundary of the King Island Ports Corporation property at the harbour (2.80km), and including the section of Don Kendall Drive to the junction of Morrison Avenue (1.63km), and Morrison Avenue to the boundary of the King Island Airport property (1.04km).                    
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                (72.11 kilometres)
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  


Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 5 November 2014

This proclamation is administered in the Department of State Growth.
